description: A short lesson to help you apply Negotiating Up â€” Influencing Without Authority.

hook.text: You have a great idea but no authority to implement it. Getting your boss's boss to say yes requires influence, not power.

buildup.text: Influencing without authority means persuading people who outrank you using logic, data, and relationship.

discovery.text: Frame ideas as solving their problems. Senior leaders respond to proposals that make their lives easier.

twist.text: The biggest mistake: presenting ideas as your passion project instead of as a solution to their priorities.

climax.text: Build credibility through small wins first. Each delivered result earns more trust for bigger proposals.

punchline.text: You don't need authority to have influence. You need credibility.

quiz.question: What's the key to influencing senior leaders without authority?
options: Framing ideas as solutions to their priorities and building credibility through small wins
